title: Alessia Cara's impression of Alanis Morissette is pretty spot-on: watch | CBC Music
text:
Ariana Grande, Céline Dion and Jamie Foxx have all shown off their musical impression skills on The Tonight Show Starring Jimmy Fallon in the past. And while Canadian pop star Alessia Cara already proved her skills on the segment two years ago, she has returned once again to take on some new challenges.

The late-night game pairs a musical artist with a beloved children's song and the guest, with host Fallon, must take turns and perform the randomly generated combination. This time around, Cara takes on breakout pop artist Billie Eilish, Cara's "favourite person ever" Amy Winehouse, and Canadian icon Alanis Morissette.

For Morissette, Cara perfectly mashes the lyrics to "Hush, Little Baby" into the melody of Jagged Little Pill hit "Hand in My Pocket." Watch it all unfold below.

Later on, Cara hit the stage with Juanes to perform their collaboration — and one of our song of the summer picks — "Querer Mejor."

Cara is currently on tour with fellow Canadian musician Shawn Mendes and will be releasing a brand new EP titled This Summer on Sept. 6.
description: The Canadian singer nails the Wheel of Impressions on The Tonight Show Starring Jimmy Fallon.
